TextEquiv.Unicode: This universall Church hath her
particular Churches, I meane the
Church of Adam & of the patriarches,
the Church of Moses and of the Pro
phetes before the birth of Christe, the
Christian Church which is so named
of Christe him elfe, and the Apostoli
call Church gathered together by the
Apostles doctrine in the name of
Christ. And finally it containeth these
particular Churches, as the Churche
of Jerusalem, of Antioch, of Aleran
dria, of Bome, of Asia, of Aphrica, of
Europe, of the Cast, of the West, ac
And yet all these Churches as it were
memders of one bodie under the only
heade Christ dfor Christ alone is the
head of his Church not onely trium
phant, but militant also) do make one
onelye Catholike Church: in which
there are not to be founde either here
sies or schismes : and for that cause is
it called the true Church, to wit, of the
right and true opinion, judgement,
faith and doctrine. For in the church
onelie is true faith, and without the
Church of God is neither anie trueth,
nor yet salvation,
So then in this article wee confesse
that all the faithful dispersed through
out the whole compasse of the earth,
and they also that at this time live in
heaven, as many I say as are alreadie
saved, or shal even until the verie end
of the world be borne to bee saved, are
one bodie, hauing gotten fellowshiy
and participation with God, & a mu
tuall communion among themselves.
And for because no man can be made
one with God, unlesse he also be holy &
pure, even as God is holy ad pure,
therefore we believe that the Church
is holy, that is, that it is sanctified by
God the Father in the bloude of the
Sonne, and the gift of the holy Ghoste,
We have hearde testimonies enough

This universall Church hath her particular Churches, I meane the Church of Adam & of the patriarches, the Church of Moses and of the Pro phetes before the birth of Christe, the Christian Church which is so named of Christe him elfe, and the Apostoli call Church gathered together by the Apostles doctrine in the name of Christ. And finally it containeth these particular Churches, as the Churche of Jerusalem, of Antioch, of Aleran dria, of Bome, of Asia, of Aphrica, of Europe, of the Cast, of the West, ac And yet all these Churches as it were memders of one bodie under the only heade Christ dfor Christ alone is the head of his Church not onely trium phant, but militant also) do make one onelye Catholike Church: in which there are not to be founde either here sies or schismes : and for that cause is it called the true Church, to wit, of the right and true opinion, judgement, faith and doctrine. For in the church onelie is true faith, and without the Church of God is neither anie trueth, nor yet salvation, So then in this article wee confesse that all the faithful dispersed through out the whole compasse of the earth, and they also that at this time live in heaven, as many I say as are alreadie saved, or shal even until the verie end of the world be borne to bee saved, are one bodie, hauing gotten fellowshiy and participation with God, & a mu tuall communion among themselves. And for because no man can be made one with God, unlesse he also be holy & pure, even as God is holy ad pure, therefore we believe that the Church is holy, that is, that it is sanctified by God the Father in the bloude of the Sonne, and the gift of the holy Ghoste, We have hearde testimonies enough
in the former Sermons. Therefore
this one of Paule shall bee sufficient
which he writeth to the Ephesians,
Christe loved the Chur the and gave
him selfe for it, to sanetifye, and to
cleanse it in the fountaine of Mater
through the worde, to make it unto
him selfe a glorious Churth not ha
ving spot or wrinekle. 6e. By which
words we understand that the church
is called undesiled & altogether clean,
not in respect of it selfe, but because of
Christ. For the Church of Christ is so
farre foorth holy as that yet everie day
it doth goe forwarde in profiting, and
is never perfect so long as it liveth on
the earth. And yet notwithstanding
the holinesse of it is moste absolutely
perfect in Christe. Whereunto verilie
belongeth that notalbe saying of the
Lord. He that is washed, hath no need
but to wash his feete onely, for hee is
wholy cleane. For the faithfull are
purely cleansed by Christe, who wa
sheth them with his bloud, but yet be
cause the fleshe doeth strive with the
spirite solong as life remaineth on the
earth, therefore the godly have neede
with faith and the holie ghost to wash
and wipe their feete, that is, the re
liques and spots wherewith they are
disteined by their daily conversation
in this worlde.
But nowe whereunto belongeth
this that is added: The Commumion
of saintes: These wordes are neither
read in Cyprian, nor Augustine, nor
yet by them expounded. Wherefore
it is likely that they were added for
the better understanding of that which
went beforerfor that it might appeare
that the catholique church is the fel
lowship or company of the faythtull,
he added The Communion of saintes,
as if he should have said, which church
is a communion of saintes. Paule

in the former Sermons. Therefore this one of Paule shall bee sufficient which he writeth to the Ephesians, Christe loved the Chur the and gave him selfe for it, to sanetifye, and to cleanse it in the fountaine of Mater through the worde, to make it unto him selfe a glorious Churth not ha ving spot or wrinekle. 6e. By which words we understand that the church is called undesiled & altogether clean, not in respect of it selfe, but because of Christ. For the Church of Christ is so farre foorth holy as that yet everie day it doth goe forwarde in profiting, and is never perfect so long as it liveth on the earth. And yet notwithstanding the holinesse of it is moste absolutely perfect in Christe. Whereunto verilie belongeth that notalbe saying of the Lord. He that is washed, hath no need but to wash his feete onely, for hee is wholy cleane. For the faithfull are purely cleansed by Christe, who wa sheth them with his bloud, but yet be cause the fleshe doeth strive with the spirite solong as life remaineth on the earth, therefore the godly have neede with faith and the holie ghost to wash and wipe their feete, that is, the re liques and spots wherewith they are disteined by their daily conversation in this worlde. But nowe whereunto belongeth this that is added: The Commumion of saintes: These wordes are neither read in Cyprian, nor Augustine, nor yet by them expounded. Wherefore it is likely that they were added for the better understanding of that which went beforerfor that it might appeare that the catholique church is the fel lowship or company of the faythtull, he added The Communion of saintes, as if he should have said, which church is a communion of saintes. Paule
